SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A VOCAL EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON

ENFORCING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it can exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If you're not familiar to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whatever born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets of paper for a separate questionnaires.

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 2, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here (✓).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires

() Pioneer health conditions
() Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
() Pioneer housing
() Pioneer education and curriculum
() Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
